greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, read by rows, where terms in row n equal the partial sums of row n-1 with 1's inserted at positions [0,n,2n-1,3n-3,4n-6,5n-10,...,n(n+1)/2-1] for n>0, with T(0,0)=1.
link: Paul D. Hanna, Rows n = 0..30, flattened.
example: This triangle T(n,k), where k=0..n(n+1)/2 in row n>=0, begins:
where row n is equal to the partial sums of terms in row n-1, with 1's inserted at positions [0,n,2n-1,3n-3,4n-6,5n-10,...,n(n+1)/2-1].
The row sums and rightmost border form sequence A129867, which equals the row sums of triangle A130469.
which has the same row sums as this triangle.
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Dec 31 2010
